blocks.text: Example 7.  A water main is supplied by water under a head of 60 ft. The head loss due to pipe friction, for a given length, is proportional to the velocity of flow. Therefore, if the water in head lost in friction when \( v \) is the velocity of flow, then:

blocks.latex: \text{Head Loss} = K_v \cdot v, \quad \text{where } K \text{ is some constant}
blocks.description: This equation represents the head loss in terms of velocity and a constant.

blocks.text: In general, then, the maximum horse-power is transmitted when the head lost is one-half the head supplied, i.e., the maximum efficiency is \( \frac{3}{2} \) or 66\%.
